record.description: Dr. Alexander S. Langsdorf, Jr. and Miss Patricia M. Reiff of the Argonne National Laboratory are shown as they measure the thickness of the concrete shield which surrounds Argonne's recently constructed multimillion volt electrostatic generator. The portion of the shield being measured is 32 inches in thickness and weighs 12 tons. It is mounted on rails and is moved into position by a small motor. Shields are necessary to prevent the scientists from being exposed to x-rays that are undesirable by-products of the nuclear reactions of the instrument.
